newsitem.title: USA: ADC to buy Apex in $26 mln stock deal.
newsitem.headline: ADC to buy Apex in $26 mln stock deal.

text.p: ADC Telecommunications Inc said on Monday it signed a definitive agreement to acquire Apex Group Inc in a stock-for-stock purchase valued at $26 million.
The transaction will be accounted for using the pooling of interests method, the company said.
ADC said it expects the acquisition to close on March 31, 1997, subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions.
Based in Columbia, Md., Apex will add software-related services to ADC's existing systems integration business. In addition, ADC said it expects to benefit from Apex's private network applications.

"This acquisition is expected to have a positive long-term impact, not only on our systems integration business, but also on ADC as a whole," said John Schofield, president of ADC's Systems Integration Division.
ADC Telecommunications, Inc. provides transmission and networking systems and broadband connectivity products for fiber optic, twisted pair copper, coaxial and wireless broadband global networks.
Apex provides advanced software engineering, installation and integration and information management services.
